intro: Psychotria longicuspis, commonly known as the long-lobed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria longicuspis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
